title: Australia Name Playing XI For Boxing Day Test Against India, Make 2 Huge Changes - NDTV Sports
summary:
Australia Names Playing XI for Boxing Day Test Against India

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Australia has announced their playing XI for the Boxing Day Test match against India, which starts on Thursday, featuring two significant changes to the lineup.

  • Scott Boland replaces the injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • Teenager Sam Konstas will debut, taking Nathan McSweeney's place.
  • Travis Head has recovered from a minor thigh strain and is fit to play.
“Trav is good to go, so he will play. No stress, no worries about injury for Trav.” - Pat Cummins

The five-match series is currently tied 1-1, following a win for India and a decisive victory for Australia.
newTitle: Australia Names Playing XI for Boxing Day Test Against India

title: "Stands Tall As A Statesman": PM Modi Remembers Atal Bihari Vajpayee - NDTV
summary:
PM Modi Remembers Atal Bihari Vajpayee on His Birth Centenary

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his birth centenary, highlighting his contributions to India's political stability and development.

  • Atal Bihari Vajpayee is celebrated as a statesman who inspired many.
  • Modi emphasized Vajpayee's role in transforming India into the 21st century.
  • Notable achievements during Vajpayee's tenure included advancements in IT and telecommunications.
  • The Golden Quadrilateral Project was highlighted as a significant infrastructure achievement.
  • Vajpayee's government initiated the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan to promote education accessibility.
  • Modi praised Vajpayee's leadership during the nuclear tests in Pokhran in 1998.
  • Vajpayee was recognized for his commitment to protecting the Constitution and democratic values.
  • His contributions to Indian culture and literature were acknowledged, showcasing his poetic talent.
“Atal Ji’s unwavering belief in the potential of our nation continues to inspire us to aim higher and work harder.” - PM Narendra Modi

In conclusion, PM Modi called for a dedication to fulfill Vajpayee's ideals and visions for India's future.
newTitle: PM Modi Remembers Atal Bihari Vajpayee on His Birth Centenary

Lyft Accuses San Francisco of $100 Million Tax Overcharge | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Lyft Accuses San Francisco of $100 Million Tax Overcharge

Publication Date: N/A

Source: Bloomberg

Lyft Inc. has filed a lawsuit against the city of San Francisco, claiming it has been overcharged $100 million in taxes over five years due to misclassification of driver compensation.

  • Lyft argues that taxes were calculated based on total passenger payments rather than Lyft's revenue model.
  • The company claims this method violates its constitutional rights and misrepresents its financials.
  • The lawsuit highlights ongoing disputes regarding gig economy companies and their classification of workers.
  • Lyft is seeking refunds for overpaid taxes, interest, penalties, and fees.
  • This case follows similar tax disputes with other companies, including Uber.
“Lyft doesn’t take operating in San Francisco for granted and we love serving both riders and drivers in our hometown city,” the company stated.

The outcome of this lawsuit could have implications for how gig economy companies are taxed and classified, potentially affecting future operations in the city.
newTitle: Lyft Accuses San Francisco of $100 Million Tax Overcharge

title: Boxing Day Test: Are India ready to make changes to ensure spearhead Jasprit Bumrah gets reinforcement? - The Times of India
summary:
Boxing Day Test: Are India ready to make changes to ensure spearhead Jasprit Bumrah gets reinforcement?

Date: MELBOURNE

Source: Times of India

As India prepares for a critical fourth Test against Australia, discussions are underway regarding potential changes to their lineup to better support pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah. The team is contemplating the introduction of an additional pacer or spinner based on pitch conditions.

  • The Indian team is considering playing an extra pacer in light of pitch conditions favoring fast bowlers.
  • Rohit Sharma acknowledges the team's reliance on Bumrah's exceptional form.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy’s dual role as a lower-order batter and occasional medium-pacer is under scrutiny.
  • Rohit spoke about the challenges of utilizing their current squad effectively given their players' form.
"It's a challenge to handle not just the bowling but the entire team. When somebody is in form, we have to make the most of that." - Rohit Sharma

The outcome of this decision may play a pivotal role in determining the success of the series for India.
newTitle: Boxing Day Test: India Considers Changes for Jasprit Bumrah's Support

title: Pakistan conducts airstrikes on Afghanistan killing 15; Taliban vow retaliation - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pakistan Conducts Airstrikes in Afghanistan, Resulting in 15 Casualties; Taliban Promises Retaliation

Date: Dec 25, 2024 - Source: Hindustan Times

In a rare military action, Pakistan conducted airstrikes on Taliban hideouts in Afghanistan, targeting suspected militant positions and leading to significant civilian casualties. The Taliban has condemned the attacks and pledged retaliation, marking a further escalation in the already strained Pakistan-Afghanistan relations.

  • Airstrikes were reported on December 24, targeting suspected Taliban locations in the Barmal district of Paktika province.
  • At least 15 individuals, including women and children, were killed, with the toll expected to rise.
  • The conflict underscores the ongoing tensions between the Afghan and Pakistani governments, particularly regarding cross-border militant activities.
  • The Pakistani Taliban has increased attacks against state forces, with Islamabad accusing the Afghan Taliban of providing them sanctuary.
“The Islamic Emirate will not leave this cowardly act unanswered but rather considers the defense of its territory and territory to be its inalienable right.”

The recent airstrikes not only exacerbate the existing humanitarian crisis but also highlight the fragile geopolitical landscape between the two nations.
newTitle: Pakistan Conducts Airstrikes in Afghanistan, Resulting in 15 Casualties; Taliban Promises Retaliation

summary:

'Pushpa 2' box office collection day 20: The Allu Arjun starrer is unstoppable as it makes Rs 14.25 crore - TOI Etimes
summary:
'Pushpa 2' Box Office Collection Day 20: Highest Grossing Indian Movie Ever

Publication Date: December 26, 2023

Source: Times of India

'Pushpa 2' has surpassed the record previously held by 'Baahubali 2', making a total collection of Rs 1089.85 crore across all languages, continuing its strong performance at the box office.

  • The film made Rs 14.25 crore on its 20th day.
  • Total collection now stands at Rs 1089.85 crore, with Rs 701.65 crore from the Hindi version and Rs 321.05 crore from the Telugu version.
  • The film experienced a slight drop on Monday but rebounded on Tuesday, likely due to increased foot traffic from the Christmas holiday.
'Pushpa 2' achieved more than Rs 50 crore on its third weekend alone.

The film's remarkable box office run demonstrates its popularity and audience appeal, solidifying its status in Indian cinema history.
newTitle: 'Pushpa 2' Box Office Collection Day 20: Highest Grossing Indian Movie Ever

title: Stock market holiday: NSE, BSE shut today for trading on account of Christmas 2024 | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Stock Market Holiday: NSE and BSE Closed for Christmas 2024

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 - Source: Live Mint

The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) will be closed today for trading due to Christmas. This marks the last stock market holiday of the year.

On December 25, 2024, no trading or settlement activities will occur in various stock segments, including derivatives and securities lending. Additionally, major global markets in the UK, US, and Europe will also be closed.

  • No trading in stocks, derivatives, or SLB on December 25.
  • Currency and commodity markets will be closed for the entire day.
  • Trading will resume on December 26, 2024.
  • The next holiday is Mahashivratri on February 26, 2025.
The last stock market holiday of the year is on Christmas, allowing for a break in trading activities.

This holiday is significant as it affects trading schedules and investor activities during the festive season.
newTitle: Stock Market Holiday: NSE and BSE Closed for Christmas 2024

summary:
Delhi Airport Advisory: Low Visibility Impacting Non-CAT III Flights

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

An advisory has been issued for flights at Delhi airport due to low visibility conditions, particularly affecting non-CAT III compliant flights.

  • The low visibility is attributed to weather conditions.
  • The advisory is expected to cause delays and rescheduling of various flights.
  • Passengers are advised to check with airlines for updates.
“Travelers should remain informed about their flight status and plan accordingly.”

This advisory highlights the importance of adhering to operational standards for safe air travel.

title: 'I don't think Virat Kohli is out of form' - says Ravi Shastri - The Times of India
summary:
I don't think Virat Kohli is out of form - says Ravi Shastri

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Former India coach Ravi Shastri has commented on the performance of Virat Kohli and Steve Smith, suggesting they are still formidable players despite recent struggles in Test cricket.

  • Joe Root and Kane Williamson have excelled in 2024, pushing Kohli and Smith down the ranks.
  • Kohli and Smith have shown they can return to form during the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Kohli's recent performance averages 25.06, significantly lower than Root's impressive 55.77.
  • Shastri emphasizes the importance of application and discipline to regain form.
“If Virat gets over that first 30-40 minutes with serious application and discipline, I don’t think he's out of form.” - Ravi Shastri

The discussion highlights the competitive nature of Test cricket and the high expectations from past stars like Kohli and Smith. Their resurgence in form could be crucial for India in upcoming matches.
newTitle: Ravi Shastri Defends Virat Kohli Amid Criticism

title: 'I shouldn't have gone to the Olympics and won medals for the country': Manu Bhaker devastated by Khel Ratna axe - Hindustan Times
summary:
Manu Bhaker Heartbroken Over Khel Ratna Exclusion

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Indian shooter Manu Bhaker, who won multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, expressed devastation upon learning that she was not shortlisted for the prestigious Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna award, despite her remarkable achievements.

  • Manu Bhaker won bronze medals in both individual and mixed 10m air pistol events at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
  • She has accumulated 17 gold, 6 silver, and 5 bronze medals across various competitions since the Tokyo Olympics.
  • Despite her achievements, only two athletes from the Indian Olympic contingent were shortlisted for the Khel Ratna award.
  • Her father revealed her disappointment, stating she regretted competing for the country.
  • The decision faced backlash from fans, prompting discussions for reconsideration by the sports ministry.
"I shouldn't have gone to the Olympics and won medals for the country. In fact, I shouldn't have become a sportsperson." - Manu Bhaker

The exclusion of such a prominent athlete from recognition has sparked significant public outrage, highlighting ongoing disparities in the acknowledgment of sporting achievements in India.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker Heartbroken Over Khel Ratna Exclusion

title: The Hindu Morning Digest, December 25, 2024 - The Hindu
summary:
The Hindu Morning Digest, December 25, 2024

Published on: December 25, 2024 06:40 am IST

Source: The Hindu

This article summarizes significant events and updates from India and around the world, including appointments of governors, accidents, and ongoing protests.

  • Ajay Bhalla appointed as Governor of Manipur, replacing Arif Mohammed Khan who moves to Bihar.
  • Five soldiers died in a vehicle accident in Poonch, Jammu and Kashmir.
  • The Union Ministry of Mines requests Tamil Nadu to hold off on the Letter of Intent regarding the Nayakkarpatti tungsten block.
  • Concerns raised over ethnic violence in Manipur by former Chief Justice Siddharth Mridul.
  • Christmas in Bethlehem remains subdued due to the ongoing war in Gaza.
  • The Ministry of Home Affairs reviews ULFA's status as an unlawful association.
  • Protests by junior doctors in West Bengal related to a high-profile rape and murder case.
  • In Bangladesh, a rise in mob violence has been reported following the end of Sheikh Hasina’s regime.
  • The Election Commission responds to Congress claims about voter list irregularities in Maharashtra.
  • The air quality panel for Delhi-NCR revokes curbs amid decreasing pollution levels.
  • Actor Allu Arjun questioned regarding a stampede incident linked to his film.
  • Lokpal calls various officials for an oral hearing regarding corruption allegations.
  • AIMIM chief Owaisi summoned by a court over pro-Palestine slogans in Parliament.
  • The 'Ladki Bahin Yojana' in Maharashtra resumes payouts for beneficiaries.
  • Heavy snowfall in Himachal Pradesh leads to road closures and increased hotel occupancy in Shimla.
  • India women’s cricket team secures a 115-run victory over West Indies with a century from Harleen Deol.
newTitle: The Hindu Morning Digest, December 25, 2024

title: Himachal Pradesh snow: Shimla, Manali turn white on Christmas; 4 dead, roads closed, tourist influx goes up - Hindustan Times
summary:
Himachal Pradesh Snowfall: Christmas Whiteout in Shimla and Manali; 4 Fatalities and Road Closures

Publication Date: Dec 25, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Tourist hubs Shimla and Manali in Himachal Pradesh have transformed into a winter wonderland due to recent snowfall. This influx of snow has resulted in over 200 road closures and a significant increase in tourist activity.

  • Shimla and Manali experience ‘white Christmas’ amid snowfall.
  • Over 200 roads have been closed, impacting vehicular movement.
  • Four fatalities reported due to vehicle skidding incidents.
  • Hotel bookings surged by 30%, reaching over 70% occupancy.
"Public Works Minister Vikramaditya Singh stated that 268 machines are deployed to clear snow on the roads."

The picturesque snowfall has attracted tourists while also posing challenges with road access and safety.
newTitle: Himachal Pradesh Snowfall: Christmas Whiteout in Shimla and Manali; 4 Fatalities and Road Closures

summary:
Baby John advance box office day 1: The Varun Dhawan starrer crosses Rs 3.5 crore in advance sales; expected to make opening day in double digit number on Christmas

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Times of India

'Baby John' is set to release in theatres today amidst the massive competition from the blockbuster 'Pushpa 2'. Despite the challenges, it has achieved a strong advance booking.

  • 'Baby John' has crossed Rs 3.5 crore in advance sales.
  • Approximately 1 lakh, 26 thousand tickets have been sold.
  • The film has been positioned at number 11 in advance box office sales for 2024.

Travis Head declared fit as Australia reveal playing XI for Boxing Day Test against India in Melbourne - The Times of India
summary:
Travis Head Fit for Boxing Day Test Against India

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Travis Head has passed a fitness test and will play in the Boxing Day Test against India at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Australian captain Pat Cummins confirmed that Head is fully fit after concerns about a quad strain.

  • Head's fitness was under question after a quad strain during the third Test in Brisbane.
  • Sam Konstas will make his Test debut, replacing Nathan McSweeney.
  • Scott Boland returns to the team for the injured Josh Hazlewood.
  • Head is currently the leading run-scorer in the series with 409 runs at an average of 81.80, including two centuries.
“It feels like the last 12 months, he’s been in this unbelievable vein of form and he just keeps going on with it.” - Pat Cummins

The five-Test series is finely balanced at 1-1 after three matches, making this Boxing Day Test critical for both teams.
newTitle: Travis Head Fit for Boxing Day Test Against India

title: Why Holiday Heart Syndrome is a risk for all age groups - The Times of India
summary:
Why Holiday Heart Syndrome is a risk for all age groups

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

Holiday Heart Syndrome refers to the increased risk of heart issues during holiday seasons, affecting individuals of all age brackets.

  • Holiday Heart Syndrome can lead to irregular heartbeats and increased hospitalization.
  • The syndrome is associated with excessive alcohol consumption during festive gatherings.
  • People of all ages can be affected, though older adults may be at heightened risk.
  • Awareness of this condition can lead to preventive measures.
“Holiday gatherings can often lead to increased heart strain, particularly from alcohol consumption.”

Be mindful during celebrations to prioritize heart health, as this syndrome highlights the importance of moderation during holiday festivities.
newTitle: Why Holiday Heart Syndrome is a risk for all age groups

title: ​Gut doctor shares top 3 hacks to lose belly fat with intermittent fasting - The Times of India
Probing role of Canadian colleges, Indian entities in trafficking racket to US: ED - Deccan Herald
summary:
Probing role of Canadian colleges, Indian entities in trafficking racket to US: ED

Published Date: 24 December 2024, Source: Deccan Herald

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating the involvement of Canadian colleges and Indian entities in a money laundering case associated with human trafficking of Indians into the US via Canada.

  • The probe stems from the tragic death of an Indian family attempting to cross the Canada-US border.
  • Suspicions have arisen about a conspiracy involving Bhavesh Ashokbhai Patel, who allegedly facilitated illegal entries.
  • Victims were purportedly charged between Rs 55 lakh and Rs 60 lakh for their illegal crossing.
  • Approximately 25,000 students are referred annually by one entity for foreign studies, a significant number of whom do not join their designated colleges.
  • The ED's investigation includes scrutiny of approximately 1,700 active agents across India involved in this racket.
“Innocent Indians were lured for this illegal entry into the US racket.” - ED Statement

The ongoing investigation reveals deep ties between a network of agents and educational institutions, raising alarms about the exploitation of students seeking foreign education.
newTitle: Investigation of Canadian Colleges and Indian Entities in US Trafficking Case

summary:
4 Expert Tips for Maintaining Your Eye Health Through the Years

As you age, your risk of developing conditions that impact your eye health grows, but you can take proactive steps to support your eye health daily.

  • Know your risk level for eye diseases and monitor symptoms.
  • Get regular eye exams, especially after age 65.
  • Wear proper eyewear that protects against UV rays.
  • Take care of your overall health through diet and quitting smoking.
According to the CDC, 90% of diabetes-related blindness is preventable.

Maintaining eye health is vital as it can prevent severe issues and enhance overall well-being.

Stock market holiday: Are BSE, NSE open or closed today for Christmas 2024? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Stock Market Holiday: BSE and NSE Closed for Christmas 2024

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

India's stock exchanges—the BSE and the NSE—are closed on December 25 for trading due to Christmas festivities, aligning with other global markets observing the holiday.

  • The BSE and NSE will also close their segments for commodity derivatives, currency derivatives, and electronic gold receipts.
  • This is the last trading holiday of 2024, with the exchanges observing a total of 16 holidays this year.
  • On December 24, the stock markets closed slightly in the red after a volatile session.
  • Nifty 50 and Sensex faced pressure due to high dollar strength and rising bond yields in the US, leading to sales by foreign institutional investors (FIIs).

Notable Statistics

“Nifty 50 ended at 23,727.65, declining 25.80 points, or 0.11%.”
“Sensex closed at 78,472.87, down 67.30 points, or 0.09%.”

Investors are currently prioritizing safety over returns in this economically turbulent context.
newTitle: Stock Market Holiday: BSE and NSE Closed for Christmas 2024

title: NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025 - SciTechDaily
summary:
NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: SciTechDaily

NASA and ISRO are preparing to launch the NISAR satellite in March 2025. Designed to monitor nearly all of Earth’s land and ice surfaces every 12 days, NISAR will track changes in ecosystems, land, and sea ice, as well as the solid Earth, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in India.

  • NISAR stands for NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar.
  • The satellite will track environmental changes every 12 days.
  • It will provide data on ecosystems, ice masses, and geological processes.
  • Significant partnership between NASA and ISRO showcasing international collaboration.
“By observing these changes at unprecedented resolution, NISAR will play a crucial role in improving environmental management and disaster response.”

The NISAR mission is poised to significantly enhance global understanding of Earth’s changing environments and better inform response strategies to natural disasters.
newTitle: NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025

title: HAL to start trial of new Tejas fighter jet in January next year - Hindustan Times
summary:
HAL to Begin Critical Trials of New Tejas Fighter Jet in January 2025

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) is set to start critical trials of the new Tejas light combat aircraft (LCA Mk-1A) in January 2025, targeting a March 31 deadline for delivery to the Indian Air Force (IAF).

  • Trials will involve testing the indigenous Astra missile, electronic warfare suite, and Israeli Elta radar.
  • HAL is negotiating with GE Aerospace for timely delivery of F404 engines, with production issues reportedly resolved.
  • The first few LCAs will be delivered with reserve engines and later upgraded with F404s.
  • Concerns have been raised about the pace of the LCA Mk-1A program impacting the IAF's combat effectiveness.
“HAL has the capability and capacity to catch-up in production once the F404 engines start coming in.”

With plans to operate around 350 LCAs in total, the IAF is prioritizing timely delivery to enhance its combat readiness.
newTitle: HAL to Begin Critical Trials of New Tejas Fighter Jet in January 2025

title: Proposal to name Mysuru road after Siddaramaiah evokes strong objections - Deccan Herald
summary:
Strong Objections to Naming Mysuru Road After Siddaramaiah

Date: 24 December 2024 Source: Deccan Herald

A proposal by the Mysuru City Corporation to name a road after Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has faced significant backlash from opposition parties and local activists.

  • The proposed road naming is for a stretch of KRS Road, which would be called 'Siddaramaiah Arogya Marga.'
  • The proposal arose from a suggestion by Congress MLA Harish Gowda and was discussed in a council meeting on November 22.
  • The JD(S) party criticized the proposal, citing Siddaramaiah's involvement in a corruption case.
  • RTI activist Snehamayi Krishna expressed public objections and threatened legal action if the proposal is enacted.
  • Siddaramaiah is currently under scrutiny due to allegations regarding the improper allotment of land.
“Naming a road after the 'corrupt' chief minister is a betrayal and insult.” - JD(S)

This proposal has sparked a significant discussion about the legacy and accountability of political figures, especially in light of ongoing allegations against Siddaramaiah.
newTitle: Strong Objections to Naming Mysuru Road After Siddaramaiah
